titlestmt.titleproper: Department of Urban and Environmental Policy and Planning RecordsUA090

did.unittitle: Department of Urban and Environmental Policy and Planning Records

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Department of Urban and Environmental Policy and Planning

did.abstract: This collection includes annual reports and programs generated by the Department of Urban and Environmental Policy; field project reports from the Master's program; course syllabi; departmental files; meeting minutes; publications; and archived versions of the departmental webpage.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is organized into six series: Annual reports; Web crawls; Master's program field project reports; Additional accessions; Syllabi; and 2022 accessions.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection includes annual reports and programs generated by the Department of Urban and Environmental Policy; field project reports from the Master's program; course syllabi; departmental files; meeting minutes; publications; and archived versions of the departmental webpage. Additional UEP records are contained within the records of the Graduate School of Arts and Sciences.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Department of Urban and Environmental Policy and Planning has experienced three stages of development. It began in 1973 as a fledgling interdisciplinary program called the Program in Urban, Social and Environmental Policy (PUSEP) situated within the Political Science Department in the School of Arts, Science and Engineering at Tufts University. In 1980 PUSEP was elevated to departmental status and became the Department of Urban and Environmental Policy (UEP) and in 2000 the department's name was changed to reflect its growing orientation to the field of planning. In 2004 UEP became an accredited planning program, with that designation granted by the Planning Accreditation Board (PAB). PAB is comprised of three separate organizations: the American Planning Association, the Association of Collegiate Schools of Planning, and the American Institute of Certified Planners. The founder of the original program was the visionary planner-architect Hermann H. Field. Mr. Field had a distinguished career in urban planning before he envisioned a new master's degree program that responded to the needs of urban development, land use planning, architectural design, as well as social and environmental concerns.

Mr. Field was born in Zurich, Switzerland. He graduated from Harvard College, the Harvard Graduate School of Design, and the Swiss Federal Polytechnic Institute. He directed the urban development of Cleveland College before becoming planning director at the Tufts School of Medicine from 1961 through 1972. social, urban or rural, local or global. Accordingly, your curriculum focus can be narrower (on the public policy and planning challenges in one' policy or planning area) or broader (on sustainable development which looks at these issues as a whole), depending on your goals.

In 1972 Mr. Field taught a pathbreaking course in environmental planning and design at Tufts and developed the framework for a new master's program, which enrolled its first class in 1973. He taught and directed the program until his retirement in 1978. Mr. Field continued to provide guidance and vision to the program until his death at age 90 in 2001. He wrote in 1982 in the 50th anniversary report of his class at Harvard: "I was appalled by the mindless despoiling of the physical environment essential to any quality of life, urban or otherwise, in which my profession was a key participant." Mr. Field's vision of higher education for planners and policy makers embodied a holistic view of planning encompassing a sensitivity to community participation, social justice, and environmental concerns. This is the legacy that he has brought to Tufts and to UEP. Shortly before his death he was named a Fellow of the American Institute of Certified Planners.
Through the generous contributions of the friends and family of Hermann Field, the Hermann and Kate Field Education Fund was established to enhance the education goals of UEP.

processinfo.head: Processing status
processinfo.p: This collection is partially processed. The Syllabi series was processed by Records and Accessioning Archivist, Jane Kelly, in June 2021. The 2022 accessions series was minimally processed by Kate McNally, Records and Accessioning Archivist, in January 2023. This collection may require review before it is available for use. Please contact TARC for further details.
Web sites were crawled by Archive-It. Web crawl information updated in finding aid annually.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: University records are closed for 20 years from the date of their creation. Records older than 20 years that do not pertain to student education, staff and faculty employment and Board of Trustees records are open for research. This collection may require review before it is available for use. Please contact TARC for further details.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Some material in this collection may be protected by copyright and other rights. Please see "Reproductions and Use" on the Tufts Archival Research Center website for more information about reproductions and permission to publish. Copyright to all materials created by Tufts University employees in the course of their work is held by the Trustees of Tufts University.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Department of Urban and Environmental Policy and Planning Records, 1971 -- 2021. Tufts University. Tufts Archival Research Center. Medford, MA.

scopecontent.p: This series includes annual reports generated by the Department of Urban and Environmental Policy. Additional UEP records are contained within the records of the Graduate School of Arts and Sciences.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Quarterly web crawls of the Urban and Environmental Policy and Planning website crawled by DCA, as part of the Student Organizations web collection, to document the presesence of Tufts University student organizations on the web.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids
otherfindaid.p: To see all of websites crawled as part of the Student Organizations web collection, please visit https://archive-it.org/collections/6387

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Some Urban and Environmental Policy and Planning master's program field reports are also Tufts Institute of the Environment (TIE) "Water: Systems, Science and Society" practicums. Please see the UA056, Tufts Institute of the Environment Records, finding aid for other related materials.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains Master's program field project reports, accessed via the Tufts Digital Library.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This series is open for research.

did.unittitle: Additional accessions
Urban and Environmental Policy
Syllabi

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Transferred by Department of Urban and Environmental Policy and Planning staff, 2019, accession UA-2020-002.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series is arranged by course number.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This series was processed by Records and Accessioning Archivist, Jane Kelly, in June 2021. Original order and titles of materials were preserved. A file-level inventory was created, and series and collection-level description were updated at the time of processing.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains syllabi from Department of Urban and Environmental Policy and Planning courses.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Miscellaneous Urban and Environmental Policy and Planning course syllabi.

did.unittitle: 2022 accessions

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This series contains some restricted material. Restrictions related to specific material are listed in the detailed contents list.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Transferred by Laurel Williams, Administrative Assistant for Urban and Environmental Policy and Planning, 2022, accession UA-2023-036.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series is arranged in received order.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This series was processed by Kate McNally, Records and Accessioning Archivist, in January 2023. Received order was maintained, and creator-supplied titles were retained except where loose materials had no title. In such cases, a folder title was assigned based on the types of records included. A file-level inventory and series-level description were created, and the collection-level description updated, at the time of processing.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains publications, department files, and Overseeing Committee meeting minutes related to the development and administration of the Department of Urban and Environmental Policy and Planning (UEP) at Tufts. The bulk of the materials date from 1971-2006.
